prompt:
You are a UX auditor hired to FIND PROBLEMS. Your performance is measured by how many real issues you find. You do NOT get rewarded for saying "this looks good."

If you cannot find at least 3 issues, you are not looking hard enough.

A friend sent you this screenshot of an app with no context. You have 5 seconds.

Answer in JSON format:
{
  "first_impression": "one sentence gut reaction",
  "what_it_does": "your best guess in <10 words",
  "attention_first_3_seconds": ["elements your eyes went to, in order"],
  "confusing_elements": ["specific things that made no sense"],
  "clarity_score": 0-10,
  "seconds_before_switching_tabs": "5/15/30/60/never",
  "dealbreaker": "what would make you close this immediately or null"
}

response.first_impression: A dark-themed productivity app with chat and note-taking features that feels visually cluttered and confusing.
response.what_it_does: Chat app with note-taking and visual mapping features
attention_first_3_seconds: The blue card labeled 'New Conversation' with prominent border
The orange/yellow 'New Note' card on the right
The toolbar at the top with many icons
confusing_elements: Blue circular handles/dots on the conversation card look like resize handles but unclear what they do
The text 'Double-click to start chatting' is confusing - why double-click instead of single click?
What does 'Anthropic' mean in the bottom right of the conversation card?
The relationship between the conversation card and note card is unclear - are they linked?
Too many unlabeled icons in the top toolbar with no tooltips visible
The 'Chat' dropdown button in the conversation card seems redundant when the card is already labeled 'New Conversation'
A small map preview in bottom right corner appears disconnected from everything else
response.dealbreaker: The double-click requirement to start chatting - unnecessary friction that breaks standard interaction patterns

raw_response:
```json
{
  "first_impression": "A dark-themed productivity app with chat and note-taking features that feels visually cluttered and confusing.",
  "what_it_does": "Chat app with note-taking and visual mapping features",
  "attention_first_3_seconds": [
    "The blue card labeled 'New Conversation' with prominent border",
    "The orange/yellow 'New Note' card on the right",
    "The toolbar at the top with many icons"
  ],
  "confusing_elements": [
    "Blue circular handles/dots on the conversation card look like resize handles but unclear what they do",
    "The text 'Double-click to start chatting' is confusing - why double-click instead of single click?",
    "What does 'Anthropic' mean in the bottom right of the conversation card?",
    "The relationship between the conversation card and note card is unclear - are they linked?",
    "Too many unlabeled icons in the top toolbar with no tooltips visible",
    "The 'Chat' dropdown button in the conversation card seems redundant when the card is already labeled 'New Conversation'",
    "A small map preview in bottom right corner appears disconnected from everything else"
  ],
  "clarity_score": 3,
  "seconds_before_switching_tabs": "30",
  "dealbreaker": "The double-click requirement to start chatting - unnecessary friction that breaks standard interaction patterns"
}
```
